text: yes ; there had been things in his boyhood that he had not understood . he understood them now . life suddenly became fiery - coloured to him . it seemed to him that he had been walking in fire . why had he not known it ?

he flew , then , rather than walked , toward the convent of the carmes dechausses , or rather deschaux , as it was called at that period , a sort of building without a window , surrounded by barren fields -- an accessory to the preaux - clercs , and which was generally employed as the place for the duels of men who had no time to lose .
we walked in single file , headed by the hunter , who ascended by narrow tracks , where two could not have gone abreast . there was therefore no room for conversation .
athos walked in the direction indicated , and reached the suburb situated at the opposite extremity of the city from that by which he and his friends had entered it .
" i warn you , this will be an exhausting stroll . we 'll need to walk long hours and scale a mountain . the roads are n't terribly well kept up . "
the mendicant hesitated at first , but at the sight of the piece of silver which shone in the darkness he consented , and walked on before athos .

side by side , captain nemo and i walked directly toward this conspicuous flame . the level seafloor rose imperceptibly . we took long strides , helped by our alpenstocks ; but in general our progress was slow , because our feet kept sinking into a kind of slimy mud mixed with seaweed and assorted flat stones .
cyrus harding and gideon spilett walked one on each side of the cart , ready to answer to any attack .
' oh , you 're sure to do that , ' said the cat , ' if you only walk long enough . '
thus d’artagnan entered paris on foot , carrying his little packet under his arm , and walked about till he found an apartment to be let on terms suited to the scantiness of his means .

he was walking home about eleven o'clock from lord henry 's , where he had been dining , and was wrapped in heavy furs , as the night was cold and foggy . at the corner of grosvenor square and south audley street , a man passed him in the mist , walking very fast and with the collar of his grey ulster turned up . he had a bag in his hand . dorian recognized him . it was basil hallward . a strange sense of fear , for which he could not account , came over him . he made no sign of recognition and went on quickly in the direction of his own house .

then turning toward m. de treville and walking with him toward the embrasure of a window , " well , monsieur , " continued he , " you say it is his eminence ’s guards who have sought a quarrel with your musketeers ? "

he passed out of the room and began the ascent , basil hallward following close behind . they walked softly , as men do instinctively at night . the lamp cast fantastic shadows on the wall and staircase . a rising wind made some of the windows rattle .
cyrus harding and the boy walked near each other , without speaking .
two lackeys dragged milady , whom each held by one arm . the executioner walked behind them , and lord de winter , d’artagnan , porthos , and aramis walked behind the executioner .
two lackeys dragged milady , whom each held by one arm . the executioner walked behind them , and lord de winter , d’artagnan , porthos , and aramis walked behind the executioner .
though bent under the gale they walked very quickly , following top , who did not hesitate as to what direction to take .
the settlers , therefore , prudently advanced towards the north point , walking over ground riddled with little holes , which formed nests for the sea - birds .
mme . bonacieux saw her go without being able to follow her ; she was like people who dream they are pursued , and who in vain try to walk .
this time the descent commenced by the new gallery . hans walked first as was his custom . we had not gone a hundred yards when the professor , moving his lantern along the walls , cried :
they walked at a good pace , a prey to the liveliest emotions .
louis xiii appeared , walking fast . he was in hunting costume covered with dust , wearing large boots , and holding a whip in his hand .
the soil they walked upon was choked with the pulverized matter fallen from the cloud .

we walked upon granite mingled with siliceous tufa . the soil shivers and shakes under our feet , like the sides of an overheated boiler filled with steam struggling to get loose . we come in sight of a small central basin , out of which the geyser springs . i plunge a register thermometer into the boiling water . it marks an intense heat of 325 ° , which is far above the boiling point ; therefore this water issues from an ardent furnace , which is not at all in harmony with professor liedenbrock 's theories . i can not help making the remark .

we were walking on sand that was fine - grained and smooth , not wrinkled like beach sand , which preserves the impressions left by the waves . this dazzling carpet was a real mirror , throwing back the sun 's rays with startling intensity . the outcome : an immense vista of reflections that penetrated every liquid molecule . will anyone believe me if i assert that at this thirty - foot depth , i could see as if it was broad daylight ?
the duke walked so fast that d’artagnan had some trouble in keeping up with him .

i can remember miss temple walking lightly and rapidly along our drooping line , her plaid cloak , which the frosty wind fluttered , gathered close about her , and encouraging us , by precept and example , to keep up our spirits , and march forward , as she said , " like stalwart soldiers . "
they walked a little distance apart from each other so as to offer a less mark for a shot .

at a depth of ten meters , we walked amid a swarm of small fish from every species , more numerous than birds in the air , more agile too ; but no aquatic game worthy of a gunshot had yet been offered to our eyes .
the colonists , walking apart , but not straying far from each other , began to skirt the edge of the lake , which was very steep .
" however , " remarked pencroft , " you must have been thrown on to the beach , and you must have had strength to walk here , since neb found your footmarks ! "
" great god ! " said mme . bonacieux , placing her hand upon her bosom , " my heart beats so i can not walk . "
athos then made him a sign to take up his basket and to walk on first .
in general , pencroft , herbert , and neb walked first , preceded by top , who poked his nose into every bush .

bazin , who had been standing listening to all this controversy with a pious jubilation , sprang toward them , took the breviary of the curate and the missal of the jesuit , and walked respectfully before them to clear their way .
mme . bonacieux tried to walk , made two steps , and sank upon her knees .
his hard eyes darted a piercing glance at the three men , who walked near him , but nothing denoted that he recollected being their fellow , or at least having been so .
" oh , my god , my god ! you see my strength fails me ; you see plainly i can not walk . flee alone ! "
